Welcome to the Heritrix community!

Yes, you always need at least one seed, a place to start crawling before 
any concrete URIs are discovered by the crawl-extract-schedule process.

Also, our default configurations then deduce what SURT prefixes to 
accept based on your seed URIs, because the most common usage scenario 
is "get these sites", where the site is implied by the starting URI. (As 
you seem to have discovered, though, this is easy to broaden to include 
other URIs, such as all .org URIs.)

Another consideration in the selection of seeds is that practically, 
when your time/storage for crawling is limited, sites discovered earlier 
wind up being crawled more deeply. So if good coverage of large, quality 
sites is important, having them discovered on day 1 of a one-week crawl 
is better than day 6. :)

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

>
